snippet: Chrysler posted an October sales increase of 22 percent, while Ford was down 1.7 percent and General Motors was essentially flat.
abstract: Autodata reports automakers sold 1.28 million vehicles in United States in October, up 6.1 percent from October 2013, for seasonally adjusted annual rate of 16.46 million vehicles sold; Chrysler posts October sales increase of 22 percent, while Ford is down 1.7 percent and General Motors is essentially flat.
lead_paragraph: Chrysler posted an October sales increase of 22 percent, while Ford was down 1.7 percent and General Motors was essentially flat.

headline.main: Robust Sales of Jeeps and Rams Lead Big Increase for Chrysler
